definition: to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
to store up/to grow (e.g. a beard)/to entertain (ideas)
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals
to stay
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Afghan forces were poised to strike.
sentences.chinese: 阿富汗的軍隊蓄勢待發。

sentences.english: The financial crisis was horribly damaging. But slowly but surely we are building up a head of steam.
sentences.chinese: 雖然金融危機造成的損失巨大，但我們正在蓄勢待發。

sentences.english: The mighty force is the readiness of those who love freedom.
sentences.chinese: 該強大力量就是那些熱愛自由者的蓄勢待發。

sentences.english: But 18-year-old Liu Haoran was ready to take on the challenge.
sentences.chinese: 不過，18歲的劉昊然蓄勢待發，接受挑戰。

sentences.english: Might a new generation of airships soon be ready for launch?
sentences.chinese: 也許新一代的空氣墊船將蓄勢待發。

sentences.english: There is the milder end of the spectrum, or hypomania, then there is the full-blown mania.
sentences.chinese: 通常是在較溫和的輕躁之後，蓄勢待發的躁狂襲來。

sentences.english: “The American economy is coiled like a spring and ready to go,” he chirped in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 2003年，“美國經濟像彈簧一樣蓄勢待發。”

sentences.english: Quality healthcare aimed at prevention is a trend that is rapidly gaining momentum.
sentences.chinese: 以預防爲主的醫療保健已經是一個趨勢，正蓄勢待發。

sentences.english: Aquatic-product prices are also gaining momentum.
sentences.chinese: 水產品價格也是蓄勢待發。

definition: see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
critical point/boundary point
to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
to leap
to spread one's wings and soar (idiom)/to develop one's abilities freely
to come thick and fast (idiom)
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
victor/winner
to wave sth/to brandish
New Age (movement)
new era/new epoch
high-spirited/full of mettle
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
